required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Satisfaction With Virtual Postoperative Visit
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Satisfaction With Virtual Postoperative Visit

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, randomized study designed to evaluate the effects of different initial postoperative follow-up modalities. Given the nature of the study, it is not possible for either the surgeons or the subjects to be blinded. To reduce bias that may occur due to each surgeon's personal preference for postoperative follow-up modality, the surgeons (rather than individual subjects) will be randomized to one of two postoperative follow-up modality groups (traditional or virtual).

primary_outcome.description: Patients will report their satisfaction with their surgical experience 6 weeks after surgery using a 10-point Likert scale, 0-"Completely Dissatisfied, 10-"Completely Satisfied"

intervention.description: Surgeons (rather than individual subjects) will be randomized to traditional Postoperative follow-up modality groups. They will adhere to this form of postoperative follow-up for all of their surgical patients (subjects) for one month.

Surgeons (rather than individual subjects) will be randomized to virtual postoperative follow-up modality group. They will adhere to that form of postoperative follow-up for all of their surgical patients (subjects) for one month.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 18 years old
- < 60 years old
- Undergoing knee arthroscopy procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 18 years old
- > 60 years old

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in this article, after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices).
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication or as required by a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The investigator who proposed to use the data.
